column1: Haudh in Gwanûr was the burial mound of Folcred and Fastred (son of Folcwine)

column2: the twin sons of Folcwine of Rohan
column3: had come South to answer the Oath of Eorl. They fought the Haradrim alongside the Gondorians
column4: but were slain on the banks of the Poros.

column1: They were laid to rest near the Crossings of Poros according to the tradition of the Rohirrim
column2: and it is said that all enemies of Gondor were afraid to pass the tomb.

column1: It has been suggested that Haudh in Gwanûr means "mound of the brothers" in Sindarin
column4: tomb") + in (pl. genitive article) + gwanûr.http://www.tolkiendil.com/langues/english/i-lam_arth/compound_sindarin_names#h Compound Sindarin names at http://www.tolkiendil.com/ Tolkiendil.com (accessed 19 June 2011) In editions of The Lord of the Rings prior to the The Lord of the Rings (50th Anniversary Edition)
column5: the circumflex (^) was omitted.Cf. Talk:Haudh in Gwanûr

column2: where players face an attack by Undead.
